definition: fragrant/sweet smelling/aromatic/savory or appetizing/(to eat) with relish/(of sleep) sound/perfume or spice/joss or incense stick/CL:根[gen1]
alcohol/wine with high alcohol content/rich/pure/good wine/sterols

sentences.english: Then ashot of thick coffee is poured on top.
sentences.chinese: 最後倒上一份香醇濃厚的咖啡。

sentences.english: An aromatic bouquet of red fruit on a base of Viennese pastry.
sentences.chinese: 維也納甜糕襯托出紅色水果的香醇。

sentences.english: A closed bottle can be kept for more than 100 years and you’ll still be good to go.
sentences.chinese: 封裝好的威士忌能存放100年並保持原有的香醇。

sentences.english: At the moment of change cup, I closed my eyes, he smelled sweet wine.
sentences.chinese: 在換杯的那一剎那，我閉上眼就聞到了酒的香醇。

sentences.english: Fresh milk, espresso, chocolate flavors with a splash of Kahlua.
sentences.chinese: 香醇的鮮奶，義式濃縮咖啡，巧克力風味的絕妙組合。

sentences.english: We really enjoyed the delicious food and excellent wine.
sentences.chinese: 我們很喜歡這些精美的事物和香醇的美酒。

sentences.english: Acres of bloom are crushed to make a drop
sentences.chinese: 幾畝地的花只榨出一滴香醇。

sentences.english: Ireland's alcohol strong coffee, for missing the mood of coffee.
sentences.chinese: 香醇濃烈的愛爾蘭咖啡，適合思念心情的咖啡。

sentences.english: Give me the taste, give me the joy of summer wine.
sentences.chinese: 你帶給我夏日紅酒般的香醇和快樂。

definition: taste/texture (of food)/how food feels in the mouth
leaving a rich aftertaste/(fig.) memorable/lingering in memory
